title: Implement Immix block and line allocator
body:
Implement the Immix allocator's block/line structure and bump-pointer allocation.

**Deliverables:**
- `ImmixBlock` (32KB): subdivided into 128-byte lines
- Block allocator: request blocks from the OS (`std.heap.page_allocator` or `mmap`)
- Bump-pointer allocation within the current block
- Overflow handling: when current block is full, get a new block
- Line-granularity metadata: mark lines as used/free
- Implement as a Zig `std.mem.Allocator` (provide `alloc`, `resize`, `free` vtable)
- Unit tests: allocate many small objects, verify they're in the right blocks/lines

**Design notes:**
- Reference: Blackburn & McKinley, PLDI 2008 (see docs/references/immix-gc.md)
- 32KB blocks, 128B lines is the standard Immix configuration
- Bump-pointer allocation is fast — similar to GHC's nursery allocation
- Don't implement collection yet (14-03); this issue is allocation only
